message.raw:
Modified RFBlaster code to handle the fact that you can't query what the RFBlaster is currently outputting.
You can only what it was last told to output through the manual web interface. This means to support remote_value_checking we have to do a bit of hacking, which is less than ideal!

message.raw:
Fixed a bug and released the h5 file lock before programming

* The static_data frequency was only being programmed to a precision of 1Hz because "%f" by default prints 6 decimal places and the number sent to the NovaTech was in MHz
* We now copy data out of the h5 file, release the file, and then program the device. This should enable asynchronous programming of hardware devices.

message.raw:
Fixed some problems with remote_value_checking code

* If remote_value_checking is enabled, program_manual() is not called on initialisation. Instead remote values are checked.
* If you selected remote values to resolve an inconsistency, an internal variable was not updated correctly and would present the remote values changed dialog repeatedly
* If you have a DDS object that does not have all sub channels present (Eg Novatech does not have a gate), then the remote_values_chaged dialog would display generic information for that subchanel (Eg "Gate: TextLabel")

message.raw:
Fixed some issues with unit conversion

* num_decimals was not being calculated around the current values
* If anything fails while trying to instantiate the unit conversion class, BLACS will handle it gracefully
* if anything fails while trying to import the unit conversion classes (other than a syntax error of course), BLACS will handle it gracefully

Following issues are still present:
  * If you have imposed a limit in your unit conversion class by forcing values outside the limit to your limit, then BLACS may raise errors when you switch between units because it has no way of knowing what these limits are. Eventually we'll propagate labscript limits to BLACS so that you don't have to impose it in a unit conversion class
  * If there is an error during the import of unit conversions then this error is only printed to the terminal, not logged, because I can't seem to get access to the logger at that time! Maybe this can be fixed at some stage

message.raw:
Added a memory profiling plugin to BLACS. This allows you to make sure that a specific action is not causing Python objects to be left behind.

Suggested usage:
1. Memory Profile -> garbage collect
2. Memory Profile -> Reset profiler
3. Perform your chosen action in BLACS
4. Memory Profile -> garbage collect
5. Memory Profile -> Diff memory usage
6. look at memprof.txt in pythonlib\BLACS to see whether any objects are not being cleared from memory.

message.raw:
Fixed a memory leak where the UI used before a 'tab restart' stayed in memory because it still had a parent.

As the AO/DO/DDS widgets had a reference to the AO/DO/DDS output_class objects, they were also kept in memory. Setting the parent to None before calling Tab.__init__ again causes all of this to be eventually garbage collected.

As the AO/DO/DDS widgets had a reference to the AO/DO/DDS output_class objects, they were also kept in memory. Setting the parent to None before calling Tab.init again causes all of this to be eventually garbage collected.

message.raw:
Fixed memory leak with dialogs.

You should either:
* call dialog.setAttribute(Qt.WA_DeleteOnClose,True) if you don't need to access the dialog once the user closes the dialog, or
* call dialog.deleteLater() once you have finished with the dialog

If you do not, the memory will not be cleared properly and your application will likely crash randomly after the dialog is closed.
message.html:
Fixed memory leak with dialogs.

You should either:
call dialog.setAttribute(Qt.WA_DeleteOnClose,True) if you don't need to access the dialog once the user closes the dialog, or
 call dialog.deleteLater() once you have finished with the dialog

If you do not, the memory will not be cleared properly and your application will likely crash randomly after the dialog is closed.

message.raw:
Fixed several issues with the AO class

* There was an issue where program_manual would be called before a device was initialised. This was because we needed to block signals for setting the range, decimals and step size which look to also emit a valueChanged signal which triggered reprogramming of the hardware
* Discovered an issue where a call to set_value in the AO class could result in a bad front panel value. set_value() can be called with a 'unit' argument, however this information was not being passed to the widgets when they were updated to reflect the new value. Please make sure you update qtutils to changeset:4eea298d2c5d or else BLACS will not run.

message.raw:
Added some missing imports and fixed the wait_table issue (that was already fixed in GTK)

* Added imports for time
* if no waits, create an empty wait table to store in teh h5 file later. *NOTE: that this differs from the GTK fix which was to not store the wait table if there were no waits. However, this was the desired behaviour that cbilling intended, and my GTK fix was without his blessing. As such, we're fixing it the intended way in Qt BLACS. This shouldn't cause any issues as far as I'm aware!*

message.raw:
Implemented connection_table monitoring

* we now save/restore plugin data
* Specifically the modified times of watched files, and whether the connection table notification was shown is now restored
* Compile and restart now closes the notification once successfully recompiled
* compile and restart will no longer allow you to cancel if the connection table has been recompiled (you MUST restart BLACS after a successful recompile)
* If the connection table (or associated files) are modified while BLACS is closed, a notification asking you to recompile will be shown

  • If the connection table (or associated files) are modified while BLACS is closed, a notification asking you to recompile will be shown

message.raw:
Plugin notification system now works

* Moved notifications.py over to Qt
* Modified connection_table plugin to have a notification (notification always shows up after 5s after start as a test, filewatching is not yet written for this plugin)
* Gave all plugins access to other Plugin() instances
* saved menu and notification instances for each plugin, in the Plugin() instance so that parts of plugins can interact internally or with other plugins
* modified the main ui file to scale a bit better (this can still be improved)

message.raw:
Settings pages are now loaded dynamically

Within each plugin module, a Plugin Class must be specified. This class then returns references to Settings, Menu and Notification classes which define the behaviour for those respective functions.

At the moment, only the Setttings class is used to populate the preferences dialog. The other functionality will follow shortly!

message.raw: Moved the "settings_pages" towards a plugins module that will allow users to add functionality to BLACS without needing to directly edit the code of BLACS. The plan is to have it handle entries in the preferences dialog, notifications and can interact with BLACS at various points of execution (eg file received from runmanager, programming hardware, etc) in either an asynchronous or synchronous way

message.raw: Setting the model of a combobox causes a currentIndexChanged event to be emitted. This had the effect of preventing programmatic changes to the units of an AO (because the unit selected of the new widget is the hardware unit, and so a call to change_unit was made with the hardware unit before the new widgets unit could be programmatically changed to the correct unit)

message.raw:
Restoring of BLACS state is now more complete.
State is restored when restarting BLACS.

Also worked on loading front panel state from the file menu. This is mostly working, though there are a few bugs (need to test thoroughly). Namely that the maximize state doesn't seem to be restored and I also got this error (I think when trying to restore a unit from A to V):
2013-08-16 17:20:49,938 WARNING BLACS: Unable to load the front panel in C:/Experiments/pinetab/load_test2.h5.
Exception:'PySide.QtGui.QStandardItemModel.indexFromItem' called with wrong argument types:
  PySide.QtGui.QStandardItemModel.indexFromItem(list)
Supported signatures:
  PySide.QtGui.QStandardItemModel.indexFromItem(PySide.QtGui.QStandardItem)

I will investigate soon!

message.raw:
Fixed some bugs (missing return statement and invalid function names) in the AO output class which prevented unit calibrations from working correctly.

Added get_save_state() and restore_save_state() functions to device_base_class for saving/restoring tab data that is not contained with AO/DO/DDS objects. I have not yet implemented passing the required data to the restore function yet.

Modified the front_panel save code to work with the Qt interface. Simplified this a bit as well so that all channels are stored together, rather than splitting across an AO/DO and DDS dataset.

Modified the front_panel save code to work with the Qt interface. Simplified this a bit as well so that all channels are stored together, rather than splitting across an AO/DO and DDS dataset.

These files are not ported to Qt, but have had WAITs implemented in them, so it is easier to update to the GTK version and port as one than try and port the old version and then merge in the WAITS.

Unfortunately I don't see how to merge nicely with Hg...Sorry! (Can you merge individual files?)

message.raw:
Moved tab_base_classes over to ZMQ IPC as was done in the gtk release. tab_base_classes is now up to date with rev 423  (part of the GTK branch)

I've also copied over setup_logging.py.

I would have used the merge functionality, but the branches have diverged so much that it is basically impossible. I'll have to do it manually, one file at a time as I come to them!
